title: Distributed Systems in One Lesson
description: A concise introduction to distributed systems, covering topics like consistency, availability, and scalability.

title: Scaling Reliability at Dropbox
description: Dropbox's journey in improving reliability and scalability, focusing on incident management and system durability.

title: Architecture to Handle 80K RPS Celebrity Sales at Shopify
description: Shopify's infrastructure evolution to handle massive flash sales through pod-based architecture and global traffic management.

title: Building a Distributed Build System at Google Scale
description: Google's evolution of their distributed build system to support 30,000 engineers working on a monolithic codebase with zero downtime migration.

title: Lessons of Scale at Facebook
description: Facebook's journey scaling from 7 million to 400 million users, covering both technical challenges of the social graph and organizational approaches to maintaining speed while growing.

title: Scaling the Backend at YouTube: A Journey Through Massive Growth
description: An exploration of how YouTube evolved its backend architecture to handle billions of users and massive content growth, with practical lessons on incremental scaling, technology choices, and engineering philosophy.
author: YouTube Engineering Team
